chapter.title: Dockerizing Applications
chapter.para: Docker is a technology that can help you to minimize resources used to run or build your applications. There are several types of applications that are suitable to run inside a docker container like daemons, web pages or applications that expose ports for communication. You can use docker for automation of building processes by adding the build process into a docker image and then running containers based on that image.
Running your application inside a docker container provides you with the following advantages:

listitem.para: You can minimize the runtime environment of the application as you can add to the application docker image just the required processes and apllications.
The image with your application is portable across machines also with different linux host systems.
You can share the image of your application by using a repository.
You can use different version of required packages in the container than the host system uses.
You can run several instances of the same application that are completely independent on each other.

chapter.para: Using docker for building of applications provides the following features:

listitem.para: You can prepare a complete building image.

chapter.para: The following sections provides you with examples and tips how to dockerize your applications.
